title: I notice that when there is bad news, more news follows to scare people, but is Yellowstone going to erupt anytime soon? - Quora

response.answer_text: Geologically speaking, yes — but “soon” in that case means sometime in the next ten to twenty thousand years. But when it erupts, it probably won’t be at Yellowstone. The North American plate drifts southwest at about twice the rate human fingernails grow, so by the time that hot spot is ready to blow again it could be up near Hudson’s Bay, not in Wyoming. From the articles I’ve seen about activity in the Yellowstone caldera, the events there aren’t indicative of a coming eruption but are rather sings that the hot spot is moving (or rather the continent is moving over it).
